snippet: Corrections appearing in print on February 15, 2012.
P.& G. is among the manufacturers trying to deliver distinctive new products that pique the curiosity of tech-conscious consumers.
abstract: Stuart Elliott Advertising column; Procter & Gamble is set to launch an estimated $150 million advertising campaign to promote Tide Pods, a new type of laundry product sold in single-use tablets that combine detergent, stain remover and brightener; product is indicative of a trend in marketing of continually delivering distinctive products that pique the curiosity of consumers conditioned to expect innovation.

headline.main: A Product to Add Sparkle and Pop to Laundry Day
headline.print_headline: A Product To Add Sparkle and Pop To Laundry Day

snippet: Incensed by the takeover of Damrosch Park by a string of special events, including New York Fashion Week, residents are demanding that the park be returned to its proper use.
abstract: Group of residents living near Manhattan's Lincoln Center, along with nonprofit group NYC Park Advocates, send a 'cease and desist' letter to city officials and to Lincoln Center demanding the termination of special events at Damrosch Park, situated on the center's campus; residents argue that a full calendar of events like New York Fashion Week has made the space off-limits to the public nearly 10 months of the year and demand that it be returned to its proper use as a city park.

headline.main: When Tents Rise in a Park, Residents See a Takeover
headline.print_headline: When Tents Rise in Park, Residents See A Takeover

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts

snippet: After shedding shares in banks and financial firms, John Paulson is now building a stake in Hartford Financial and calling for a breakup of the insurance company.
abstract: After shedding shares in banks and financial firms, John Paulson is now building a stake in Hartford Financial and calling for a breakup of the insurance company.

headline.main: Hedge Funds Switch Positions, While Paulson Switches Investing Style

snippet: Timothy D. Cook, Apple's chief executive, spoke at a Goldman Sachs conference on a wide range of topics, including conditions in Apple suppliers' factories, the company's growing cash hoard and how it viewed the television market.
abstract: Timothy D. Cook, Apple's chief executive, spoke at a Goldman Sachs conference on a wide range of topics, including conditions in Apple suppliers' factories, the company's growing cash hoard and how it viewed the television market.

headline.main: Apple Chief Unveils a New Product: Himself

snippet: Mixologists have been slipping smoky flavor into their cocktails for years, but now many use actual smoke.
abstract: Mixologists have been using mezcals and peaty Scotches to slip a little smoky flavor into their potions for some years; but today many bartenders will settle for nothing less than actual smoke; there are as many ways to deliver embers to alcohol as there are woods to burn, but the most common tool, and the simplest method, is the smoke gun.

headline.main: If There’s Smoke, There’s a Bartender
headline.print_headline: If There’s Smoke, There’s a Bartender

snippet: As usual, the Web has erupted with rumors and speculation on what's new about Apple's next iPad. Worth noting are those publications and writers with solid track records on unreleased Apple products in years past.
abstract: As usual, the Web has erupted with rumors and speculation on what's new about Apple's next iPad. Worth noting are those publications and writers with solid track records on unreleased Apple products in years past.

headline.main: The Next iPad: Rounding Up the Chatter

snippet: A young inventive engineer explains how he and a partner build a 40-person (and growing) company from observations of mushrooms growing on wood chips.
abstract: A young inventive engineer explains how he and a partner build a 40-person (and growing) company from observations of mushrooms growing on wood chips.

headline.main: A Young Green Innovator Turning Fungi into Jobs Muses on the Path to Breakthroughs

snippet: A start-up financed in part by Barry Diller will use thousands of tiny antennas to pull broadcast signals out of the air and deliver them to subscribers.
abstract: A start-up financed in part by Barry Diller will use thousands of tiny antennas to pull broadcast signals out of the air and deliver them to subscribers.

headline.main: New Service Will Stream Local TV Stations in New York
headline.print_headline: A New Way To Stream Broadcast Television

snippet: A father shot his daughter's laptop over a Facebook post, travel tips from those in the know, downloading some romance and other consumer-focused news from The New York Times.
abstract: A father shot his daughter's laptop over a Facebook post, travel tips from those in the know, downloading some romance and other consumer-focused news from The New York Times.

headline.main: Tuesday Reading: Dad Shoots Kid's Laptop Over Facebook Post
